summary: This document appears to be a series of text message or email exchanges between Bureau of Prisons staff on July 10, 2019, discussing the housing and psychological assessment of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It references a need for a POFU (possibly a psychological or psychiatric evaluation form) for Epstein and mentions another inmate, Tartaglione.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate being discussed in the messages; staff note he will need a POFU (psychological/psychiatric evaluation form) for crisis the following day.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Another inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center; a staff member asks if he was seen.

connections.description: Both were inmates housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, as indicated by the staff discussion.

events.title: Staff discussion about Epstein's status
events.description: Bureau of Prisons staff exchange messages about inmate housing, checking on Epstein's condition, and noting he will need a POFU (psychological/psychiatric evaluation form) for crisis the next day.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.address: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: Federal detention facility where Jeffrey Epstein was housed at the time of these communications.

keyFacts: The communications date from July 10, 2019, the day before Epstein's death on July 11, 2019.
Staff discuss housing Epstein and note he will need a 'POFU tomorrow for crisis,' indicating planned psychological/psychiatric evaluation.
Another inmate, Tartaglione, is mentioned, showing staff were managing multiple high-profile inmates.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and appears to be internal Bureau of Prisons correspondence regarding inmate management.
